image.altText: Ambulances in a line in an underground driveway

props.synopsis: A parliamentary inquiry into ambulance ramping in Tasmania is told emergency department staff have walked away from the job over patient safety concerns, leaving a deficit of skilled workers to manage a strained healthcare system.

title.children: 'Why would I want to work here?': Royal Hobart Hospital ED struggles to keep skilled staff, ramping inquiry hears

image.altText: Smoke rises after an Israeli air strike on Gaza.

props.synopsis: As Israeli forces fight Hamas militants among ruined buildings in the north of the Gaza Strip, inching their way closer to two big hospitals, the UN human rights chief accuses both Israel and Hamas of war crimes.

title.children: Heavy fighting in northern Gaza as White House says Israel has agreed to four-hour 'humanitarian pauses'

image.altText: a black dual cab ute dumped at Wayne Richards Oval in Port Macquarie

props.synopsis: The 26-year-old will appear in court today facing several firearms charges. He was one of two arrested in relation to a series of shootings yesterday on the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: Man charged over shootings in Port Macquarie that led to 13-hour manhunt

image.altText: A dozen King Island Dairy double brie cheese wheels splayed with their labels showing.

props.synopsis: The potential sell-off of the only dairy processing plant on King Island comes as a little surprise to locals who have witnessed a dwindling industry.

title.children: What'll happen to King Island Dairy? Locals are asking the question as owner eyes sale

image.altText: An Optus store sign seen through a border of leaves.

props.synopsis: First the hack, then the outage. Many customers want out of Optus, while others want compensation. Here's a look at your consumer rights.

title.children: Can you sue Optus, or end your contract early? Here are your rights and how to make a claim

image.altText: Scars from a mastectomy

props.synopsis: When Melanie Law's life depended on having her breasts removed, her appearance was the least of her concerns. But strangers and even health professionals saw it as an issue.

title.children: Melanie's life depended on having her breasts removed. When she chose to stay flat-chested, she was asked what her 'husband thought'

image.altText: flowers and pictures with candles

props.synopsis: Friends and family of the five people killed in a horror pub crash in Daylesford call for ongoing support as they give tearful tributes to their loved ones.

title.children: Outpouring of grief in Melbourne's west for Daylesford victims

image.altText: A heat map of the Earth on July 11, 2023.

props.synopsis: Between November 2022 and October this year, the average global temperature was more than 1.3 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, and more record highs are on the way.

title.children: Mapping the world’s hottest 12 months

image.altText: A man inside a ship, wearing a big coat, and looking out to see

props.synopsis: Partisans in Crimea claim they provided critical intelligence to Ukraine's armed forces about Russia's Black Sea navy headquarters before it was destroyed by a missile attack in September.

title.children: 'Our lives are at stake': How a secret underground movement is battling the Russian occupation of Crimea

image.altText: 11 search and rescue workers walk towards a dense row of trees search the ground. Some are wearing orange hi-vis

props.synopsis: Police are searching a Tasmanian hiking track and bushland for a missing man, a week after opening a criminal investigation and six years since he went missing.

title.children: Police comb Duckhole Lake area for clues in Tasmanian hiker's 2017 disappearance

image.altText: A large image of Netayahu's face, partially obscured by flags and protesters

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu is being blamed by many Israelis for the failures that contributed to the horrors of October 7. He is now trying to hang on to power.

title.children: 50 years on from the Yom Kippur War, will history repeat itself for Israel's PM?

image.altText: A big stack of BioPak takeaway coffee cups sit on a table.

props.synopsis: Sold and marketed as environmentally friendly, compostable food packaging has been exploding in popularity in Australia. But is it any better than the plastic it's replaced?

title.children: Are compostable coffee cups actually any better for the environment?

image.altText: A mother koala with her joey on her stomach up in a tree, both looking towards camera

props.synopsis: Conservative politicians including Keith Pitt and Craig Kelly say killing koalas with blunt force trauma is part of the plan to make way for a Queensland wind farm. But there's more to the story.

title.children: 'Wind farms killing koalas': Are conservative claims about blunt-force euthanasia correct?

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt with close cropped grey hair stands behind a white picket fence.

props.synopsis: Adam Kneale will receive from the Western Bulldogs what lawyers are describing as the largest jury payout awarded to a sexual abuse survivor.

title.children: Western Bulldogs to appeal after 'biggest' sexual abuse compensation win in Australian history

image.altText: Generic avatars in Roblox protest holding sigs that say FEAR with the word crossed out.

props.synopsis: Protests over the Israel-Gaza war have swept the globe — and the virtual worlds of video games are no exception.

title.children: Burning flags in a kids' game: Why protests about the Israel-Gaza war are happening in Roblox

image.altText: A man looking sad and staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Kamal El-Gadba was in Gaza for the first time in 12 years, meeting the newest additions to his family and catching up on old times. Then war broke out.

title.children: Australian man reunited with daughters after weeks stuck in Gaza

image.altText: people walking outside a store

props.synopsis: Telecommunications experts warn Australia’s major mobile providers are vulnerable to another major outage due to gradual cost-cutting and a critical lack of regulation.

title.children: 'Unacceptable': Experts say Optus coverage outage could happen again

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese with Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk in the background

props.synopsis: It's helpful for the Albanese Government to have all mainland states in Labor hands – but only up to a point, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: When Labor states don't dance to Albanese government's tune

image.altText: Luis Manuel Díaz waves as he arrives to the airport.

props.synopsis: The father of Liverpool striker Luis Díaz is released by members of a guerilla group who kidnapped him in northern Colombia, ending a 12-day ordeal for the family.

title.children: Father of Liverpool striker Luis Díaz released after kidnapping 'mistake' by Colombian guerillas

image.altText: Two actors standing side by side in front of the Sydney Harbour Bridge with one wearing a cap with NCIS written on it

props.synopsis: The head of scripted for the new NCIS: Sydney has used the knowledge of her hometown to develop a unique character for the new wing of the television franchise.

title.children: NCIS: Sydney uses its homegrown crew to highlight the best of the city

image.altText: An Australian female tennis player hits a double-fisted backhand at the Billie Jean King Cup.

props.synopsis: Storm Hunter helps Australia to a 2-1 victory in its tie against Kazakhstan, but it is not enough to stay alive in the teams tournament as Alicia Molik makes her farewell as captain.

title.children: Aussies exit Billie Jean King Cup despite win over Kazakhstan

image.altText: O'Neil has a concerned expression, hand to mouth, while she looks towards Albanese.

props.synopsis: With the Coalition on his right and a High Court ruling and the Greens on his left, Anthony Albanese finds himself in a fraught political position that could prove catastrophic to his government, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: In just 16 minutes, the High Court made a decision that put Albanese in a tight spot

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Optus will provide eligible customers, including small businesses, 200GB of free data as compensation for its nationwide outage that lasted for more than 12 hours and impacted more than 10 million Australians.

title.children: 'They're not listening to us': Business owner outraged by Optus data offer after outage

image.altText: A woman in a blue shirt and akubra holds a laptop and phone in a yard with horses.

props.synopsis: As fibre to the premise internet arrives in far-flung pockets of Queensland, some in the regions want to bust the "urban myth" that all bush broadband is bad.

title.children: 'Phenomenal' internet speeds in remote outback towns rivalling city networks

image.altText: A deep blue lagoon at night, light up by lighting and a red glow from a nearby mountain.

props.synopsis: The decision came after an uptick in tremors that have been shaking the surrounding area on the Reykjanes peninsula, in Iceland's south-west, in recent weeks.

title.children: Iceland's iconic Blue Lagoon closes due to fears of potential volcanic eruption

image.altText: Woman with black glasses and a blue shirt taking a call with headphones.

props.synopsis: The domestic violence helpline takes 18,000 calls a year from women who may have few other options to find help, as statistics reveal 37 per cent of women in NSW over the age of 15 are experiencing physical and/or sexual violence.

title.children: Josephine's been taking domestic violence crisis calls for 20 years. This is what she's learned

image.altText: A brown cow stands in the foreground, with green pasture, trees and hills in the background.

props.synopsis: As the government calls for input on a plan to help the agriculture and land sectors cut emissions, farmers say they're keen to adapt — but not at the expense of food production.

title.children: Cutting cow burps and other 'smart investments' key to curbing emissions, farmers say

image.altText: a man in a lue suit with a red bear holding a coke, walking outside court

props.synopsis: Shannon James Finemore was walking home with a friend in Fortitude Valley following a night of celebrations in 2020. But he never made it home.

title.children: 'Who would do this to my child?': Queensland duo jailed for fatal Melbourne Cup day attack

image.altText: Several red hens investigate camera, scratching in a dirt ground of a chicken pen

props.synopsis: For five months of the year, hens stationed along the Murray River in South Australia play an important role in protecting the state against diseases like Japanese encephalitis.

title.children: Why 'sentinel chickens' are a first line of defence against mosquito-borne disease

image.altText: Man in white stands in front of Picasso painting with yellows and reds and blues.

props.synopsis: The Pablo Picasso painting has sold for more than $US139 million ($217 million), making it 2023's most valuable work of art sold globally at auction. But what makes it so special?

title.children: A lover, a watch and a defining era. Behind Picasso's $217m Femme à la montre

image.altText: Dominic Gaynor arrives at court wearing a suit and sunglasses

props.synopsis: A Sydney police officer who pointed his gun towards a colleague after warning him not to reveal spoilers about the movie Top Gun: Maverick is handed a two-year good behaviour bond and a conviction.

title.children: Sydney cop sentenced for pointing gun towards colleague over spoilers for Tom Cruise movie

image.altText: Multiple images of Meg Lanning in an Australia cricket uniform.

props.synopsis: Meg Lanning's record as an unflappable Australian skipper will stand the test of time, but the legacy she leaves for women's sport will make meaningful change now.

title.children: Why Australia's greatest captain acknowledges her greatest disappointment as the key moment of her career

image.altText: Three high school girls sit in a classroom with judgmental expressions.

props.synopsis: Nearly two decades after Mean Girls hit theatres and launched an endless amount of quotes into our cultural lexicon, the franchise is returning with a musical twist.

title.children: Mean Girls returns in musical form, but you wouldn't know it from the trailer
